tn.ref: Go there to listen
tn.text: It is more important to go to the temple to listen and learn of God's law in order to obey God than it is to offer sacrifices but continue to sin against God.

tn.ref: speak with your mouth
tn.text: To make a promise or vow to God.

tn.ref: Do not be too quick ... do not let your heart be too quick
tn.text: These two phrases mean the same thing. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: let your words be few
tn.text: "do not say too much"

tn.ref: for God has no pleasure in fools
tn.text: One characteristic of a fool is to make promises or vows that they have no intention of keeping or fulfilling.

tn.ref: Do not allow your mouth to cause your flesh to sin
tn.text: "Do not let what you say cause you to sin" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: Why make God angry ... hands?
tn.text: "It would be foolish to make God angry ... hands." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: destroy the work of your hands
tn.text: "destroy everything you do" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: For in many dreams, as in many words, there is meaningless vapor
tn.text: "Multiplying words does not give them substance, just like having many dreams make them any more real."

tn.ref: the poor being oppressed and robbed
tn.text: AT: "people oppressing poor people and robbing them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: just and right treatment
tn.text: The words "just" and "right" mean basically the same thing and refer to the kind of treatment that people deserve. AT: "fair treatment." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

tn.ref: do not be astonished
tn.text: "do not be surprised" (UDB)

tn.ref: there are people in power
tn.text: AT: "there are people with authority" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: even higher ones over them
tn.text: There are other men who rule over the men in authority. AT: "men who have even more authority than they do" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: the produce of the land
tn.text: AT: "the food that the land produces" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

tn.ref: This, too, is vapor
tn.text: Just as a vapor has no substance, so there is no satisfaction in desiring money. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: As prosperity increases
tn.text: AT: "As a person becomes more prosperous" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

tn.ref: so also do the people who consume it
tn.text: Possible meanings are 1) "so also the person spends more money" or 2) "so also there will be more people who use his wealth."

tn.ref: What advantage in wealth is there to the owner except to watch it with his eyes?
tn.text: AT: "The only benefit that the owner has from wealth is that he can look at it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: The sleep of a working man is sweet
tn.text: a man who does good or honest work can be content with himself knowing He did a good day's work regardless of his pay.

tn.ref: whether he eats little or a lot
tn.text: "whether he eats a little bit of food or a lot of food"

tn.ref: does not allow him to sleep well
tn.text: a rich person is never satisfied with his wealth. He stays awake at night being concerned about his money. AT: "keeps him awake at night"

tn.ref: riches hoarded by the owner
tn.text: AT: "an owner hoards riches" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: through bad luck
tn.text: Possible meanings are 1) "through misfortune" or 2) "through a bad business deal."

tn.ref: his own son ... is left with nothing in his hands
tn.text: Here the phrase "in his hands" refers to ownership. AT: "he leaves no possession for his own son" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: a man is born naked ... he will leave this life naked
tn.text: In addition to being without clothing, here the word "naked" emphasizes that people are born without any possessions. AT: "a man is naked and owns nothing when he is born ... he will leave this life the same way" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: he will leave this life
tn.text: AT: "he will die" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_euphemism]])

tn.ref: He can take in his hand nothing
tn.text: AT: "He can take nothing with him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: as a person came, so also he must go away
tn.text: This refers to the birth and death of a person and expresses the same idea as the previous verse.

tn.ref: So what profit does anyone get in working for the wind?
tn.text: The writer uses this question to emphasize his point that there is no benefit in working for the wind. AT: "No one gets any profit in working for the wind." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: working for the wind
tn.text: Possible meanings are 1) "trying to catch the wind" or 2) "working for the air he breathes"

tn.ref: During his days he eats with darkness
tn.text: Here the word "darkness" refers to sad circumstances. Possible meanings are 1) "During his life he eats in mourning" or 2) "His life is spent in mourning" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: and is greatly distressed with sickness and anger
tn.text: AT: "and suffers greatly, being sick and angry" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

tn.ref: Look
tn.text: "pay attention" or "listen up"

tn.ref: what I have seen to be good and suitable
tn.text: Here the words "good" and "suitable" mean basically the same thing. The second intensifies the meaning of the first. AT: "what I have seen to be the best thing to do." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

tn.ref: during the days of this life that God has given us
tn.text: AT: "as long as God allows us to live" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: man's assignment
tn.text: Possible meanings are 1) "man's reward" or 2) "man's lot in life."

tn.ref: riches and wealth
tn.text: These two words mean basically the same thing. They refer to money and the things that a person can buy with money. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

tn.ref: receive his share and rejoice in his work
tn.text: This is expressing the ability to be content and to enjoy one's work.

tn.ref: he does not call to mind
tn.text: Here the word "he" refers to the person to whom God has given a gift. AT: "he does not remember" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: the days of his life
tn.text: AT: "the things that have happened during his lifetime" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: keep busy
tn.text: "stay busy"
